CryptoDB is an integrated genomic and functional genomic database for the parasite Cryptosporidium and other related genera. CryptoDB integrates whole genome sequence and annotation along with experimental data and environmental isolate sequences provided by community researchers . The database includes supplemental bioinformatics analyses and a web interface for data-mining.

For a list of the data integrated into CryptoDB and the related publications please see Data Sets.

Please check our annual EuPathDB Workshop at UGA exercises to see the scope of data and functionality in our sites.

Much of the data in CryptoDB is provided by independent researchers. For a list of the data integrated into CryptoDB and the related publications see Data Sets. Please cite the authors/providers when you use their data.

Each project in EuPathDB benefits from the advice and mentoring of people from each specific community.

CryptoDB is a member of pathogen-databases that are housed under the NIAID-funded EuPathDB Bioinformatics Resource Center (BRC) umbrella. The EuPathDB team is mainly distributed between the University of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and the University of Georgia in Athens, Georgia.

The data at this site is provided freely for public use, through the contributions of many researchers including those involved in generating the genome sequences. The data is not guaranteed to be accurate as it often reflects the results of ongoing research. When using data obtained from any EuPathDB project, it is important to cite the original publications and contributors of that data.
Please see Citing CryptoDB below.

When citing CryptoDB itself, please use:

CryptoDB: a Cryptosporidium bioinformatics resource update. 2006 Jan 1;34:D419-22. Heiges M, et al.

Much of the data in CryptoDB is provided by independent researchers. Please cite them if you use their data. For a list of the data integrated into CryptoDB and the related publications please see Data Sets.
